file_content.text: Thanks for your help. Corellian StarDrives won't recover from this one. I'm watching the ruins, and nothing's moving.
That was amazing--I saw the fires through my optics.
Part of me still wishes we could have blown all the charges at once, but that... Corellian StarDrive's won't be funneling any more money.
I enjoyed that destruction far more than I expected.
That was entertaining, thanks.
Nothing brightens the day like a batch of high explosives. Those were some big booms.
This demonstration will remind the other corporations to toe the line.
That's the price of resistance
Politics is for the brass and the movers and shakers, I just blow up what they tell me to.
You really pulled my fat out of the fire. You ever need some custom work done, I owe you.
If we're done, I'm leaving.
I've got to go find my partner, but you've done more than enough already. Thank you.
I wouldn't tell you your job, but there's still some charges down there. We need to detonate them all.
Grab some turf, my lord, if you want to watch.
General "Mother" Hesker sent someone to check on me, eh? Well, we're just about to start the fireworks.
You're just in time for the show! Grab some turf. Things are about to get fun.
The Corellian StarDrive corporation has been funding resistance cells all over the city, so I'm turning their headquarters into a crater.
As soon as I get the all clear from my buddy down there, I'll flip the switch and... boom. No more corporation.
Rebellion like that cannot go unpunished.
A suitable fate.
Agreed. They're the biggest corporation on Corellia, so they thought the Empire wouldn't slap them down. This should--Ah, there's my call.
A corporation that cares about profits should be open to negotiation.
Destroying them seems extreme.
They're funding resistance cells all over the city. General Hesker wants an example made--and here's the call I'm expecting.
Stop wasting time and blow it!
My buddy's down there placing the last charges, when he's out of the way he'll call--ah, that'll be him now.
Blow it quick, they know we're here! Repeat, the Republic's found us, blow it!
Blast, long range detonator's not working! The 'Pubs must have put a dampening field up.
Surely, you must have thought something like this might happen.
You must have a back up plan.
I'd be pretty lousy at my job if I didn't have a backup plan. Just didn't see it getting this bad.
Does he need help getting out of there?
What about your partner?
He'll get himself out. Right now we've got a bigger gundark to wrestle.
That's the problem with demolitions--too many things can go wrong.
Explosives are too reckless.
You like to get up close and personal, eh? Maybe there's a chance to salvage this run, then.
A short-range detonator will still blow the charges, but you'd have to fight half the 'Pub army while doing it.
I wouldn't last ten seconds--respectfully, sir, you've got to help.
Be thankful that you've given me an outlet for my rage.
I'll make up for your failure.
The 'Pubs won't stand a chance with you taking care of things, my Lord.
Watch. The Dark Side is more powerful than your explosives.
An enjoyable diversion.
Your work's cut out for you, my Lord, Force or no Force.
I like an explosion as much as the next person. This should be fun.
Might as well.
The Pub's will certainly make it fun for you, but the fireworks are worth it.
I'll clean up your failure, but central command will hear about this.
I'll clean up your mess.
Report me, as long as you're willing to blow this plant to the Outer Rim.
This will be too easy.
The 'Pubs have made that place a hornet's nest. Might be trickier than you think.
There's a delay on each bomb after it's triggered. That'll give you time to get out of the blast zones.
Don't stick around after you set them off--the timer's not that long, and it's a big boom.
No, I don't. [Refuse quest]
Better me than you, right? Fine, I'll take care of it myself. See you around.
Ever seen a stardrive go critical? It's the prettiest white fire--like a tiny sun. When Corellia StarDrive goes, it'll look like a whole new galaxy.
